channel.title: Dot Physics on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Dot Physics on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: What Is the Magnetic Constant and Why Does It Matter?
item.description: This persnickety number determines the strength of magnetic fields. It figures in everything from motors and generators to audio speakers. Oh, and without it we’d live in eternal darkness.

item.title: What Is the Magnetic Constant and Why Does It Matter?
item.description: This persnickety number determines the strength of magnetic fields. It figures in everything from motors and generators to audio speakers. Oh, and without it we’d live in eternal darkness.

item.title: What Is the Electric Constant and Why Should You Care?
item.description: The force between electrical charges is kind of a big deal—without it, the universe would be a primordial soup and you would not exist. That force is determined by the electric constant.

item.title: What Is the Electric Constant and Why Should You Care?
item.description: The force between electrical charges is kind of a big deal—without it, the universe would be a primordial soup and you would not exist. That force is determined by the electric constant.

item.title: AC or DC: Which Is Better?
item.description: Your gadgets run on direct current, but the electricity in your home is alternating current. What’s up with that?

item.title: AC or DC: Which Is Better?
item.description: Your gadgets run on direct current, but the electricity in your home is alternating current. What’s up with that?

item.title: Einstein Showed That Time Is Relative. But … Why Is It?
item.description: The mind-bending concept of time dilation results from a seemingly harmless assumption—that the speed of light is the same for all observers.

item.description: The mind-bending concept of time dilation results from a seemingly harmless assumption—that the speed of light is the same for all observers.
